title: Sheriff's office: 7-year-old girl accidentally shot in Hanover County
content:
A 7-year-old girl was accidentally shot with a handgun on Saturday in the Beaverdam area of Hanover County, according to the sheriff's office.
The Hanover County Sheriff's Office was called to the 20000 block of Beaverdam Road at about noon on Saturday, Sgt. Terry Sullivan said.
The girl had been shot once in her calf and was flown to VCU Medical Center for treatment, according to Sullivan, who said the injury was considered non-life-threatening.
"Investigators are still collecting information and consulting with the Commonwealth Attorney’s Office regarding the circumstances that led to this tragic incident," Sullivan said.
